intro: Mycaranthes longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract mycaranthes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks.
